name: unfolding frames: film ragas
description:
limited edition of 108 hand repainted digital prints on stretched canvas. 40 cm x 30 cm

The original was painted on Rajastani handmade silk paper in Mumbai in August 2008.  Formally, it represents Mehta's focus on Film as the integrative medium for a total music artwork.

name: Songlines Jewels' Bhakti (Devotion)
description:
Published in an anthology of innovative music notation entitled Notations 21 (Author Theresa Sauer, Thames and Hudson), interpreted and performed as a musical score by Mehta's "Trio ORKA-M"most notably at the New Music and Theatre Festival in Ruemlingen, Switzerland in 2006 (see the videos section of the orka-m.com/institute site for a video of that concert!).  

This painting was created  while Mehta had his Senior Performing and Creative Arts Fellowship in Chennai, India in March, 2006 for his project "Innovative Music Meetings: Creative collaborations with Carnatic Music" courtesy of the American Institute of Indian Studies. Other than the obvious Indian music inspiration, the painting showed resemblances to australian aboriginal dot paintings and their ethos of "Songlining" which Mehta subsequently delved into.

This limited edition of 201 screen-prints was made on handmade Indian silk-paper, and are sold hand-retouched and hand signed so that each print becomes an authentically unique artwork in and of itself.  As this was the first print in the entire music-artwork collection, Bhakti has been circulated widely and some of the world's leading architects, scientists, philanthropists have already purchased them.

name: "ENERGY OF MUSICALITY"
description:
Exclusive Limited Edition of 27 Hand-Retouched and Hand-Signed Prints with Acrylic Gold Paint on Stretched Canvas! 

This is the iconic painting for ORKA-M and symbolically displays the spiritual core of the ORKA-M vision through "the energy of musicality". 

The most exclusive print of the collection is delivered as an entirely unique artwork through the time-intensive repainting on canvas (original painting is made on handmade Indian silk paper).  

Dimensions are 60 cm. x 80 cm (Released Summer 2009.)

name: imaginational map 2
description: (Size: 48 cm x 38 cm) Limited edition of 52 highest quality digital prints on canvas (unframed), hand signed. News! will be released as a part of a contribution on sounding buildings in an article entitled "Beyond Notation" in the Leonardo Music Journal in November 2011 by MIT Press! The original pencil drawing on graph paper of imaginational map 2 or “imap 2”, made in Berlin, Germany in 2001, reveals the wide range of influences—from mathematics, architecture, and technology to choreography and the visual arts—on Rajesh Mehta’s artistic work, which includes various musical and interdisciplinary productions. The drawing formed the basis for the musical composition for the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (M.I.T.) DVD “Sounding Buildings–Inaugurating M.I.T.’s Simmons Hall”, in collaboration with Architect Steven Holl, October 2002. See & Hear the video imap 2 also was the basis of the musical and navigational score for he live performance of Sounding Buildings in the Lewis Glucksman Modern Art Gallery, Cork, Ireland (Architects: Sheila O`Donnell and Mark Tuomey). See & Hear the video
